page.title: 09Transport
page.content: Public Transport in the Dereham area has declined with the increase of more cars on the roads. The county bus service has dwindled to approximatey ten buses a day, and also the railway closed in l968, allowing only a few goods trains a day through the town. Consequently, the private car ownership ratio is very high in this area. Private coach services run into town several days a week from outlying villages. School children are also collected from their villages by private bus. Some people have to rely on a taxi service or Community Bus service to get into town as they have no transport. Some Old Peoples Clubs in the villages arrange volunteer drivers to collect the elderly to bring them into town to collect pensions, do shopping and visit the Doctor.
